title: The First Passover and the Exodus
summary: Exodus 12 establishes the Passover, where the blood of a lamb protects Israelite homes from death. At midnight, God strikes down the firstborn in Egypt. Pharaoh finally releases the Israelites, and they leave Egypt in haste.

faq.question: What was the purpose of the lamb’s blood on the doorposts?
faq.answer: It was a sign for the Lord to ‘pass over’ those homes and spare the firstborn.

faq.question: Why is Passover significant?
faq.answer: It marks God’s deliverance of Israel and becomes a lasting memorial of His power and mercy.
